pullRequest.title: Migrate untyped views to dashboards, migrate widget filters to queries & push down query strings, time ranges & streams from query to widgets/search types
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description

Motivation and Context


Before this change, views which had been created before 3.2 had no
specific type and showed up in both search and dashboard lists. In
addition, due to the removal of the UI feature, widget filters have
become inaccessible but are still executed upon searching.
This PR is addressing both of these issues by iterating over existing
views with no type field and modifies those, by:

Setting type to DASHBOARD
Iterate over all existing widgets, and:

checks for the presence of a
filter. If it is present, its content will be moved to the widget's
query field, concatenating it (using the AND operator) if it already
exists.
push down the query string, time range & streams selection of the enclosing Query to the widget.


Iterate over all existing queries and set query, time range & streams with neutral selections.

Fixes #7366.
How Has This Been Tested?



Screenshots (if appropriate):
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Refactoring (non-breaking change)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)

Checklist:



 My code follows the code style of this project.
 My change requires a change to the documentation.
 I have updated the documentation accordingly.
 I have read the CONTRIBUTING document.
 I have added tests to cover my changes.

commit.message: Allowing relative paths with directory prefixes by changing check in importer.
Adding migration for untyped views, turning them into dashboards.
Concatenate existing query, add tests.
Adding license headers.
Extracting methods to make intentions clearer.
Extracting query concatenation method.
Restructure migration, merge query string from query of widget.
Fixing handling of empty queries list.
Extract and simplify types.
Adapting tests and fixtures.
Adding missing searches fixtures.
Fixing type handling.
Adapting tests to search type query/timerange sync.
Adding license headers.
Adding test case for merging query string/timerange from query.

nodes.bodyText: You can reuse the mergeQueryString method here.

I think it would be even better to verify that nothing was even read. Not writing anything could result from either the migration having been completed before OR not finding any views in need of migration.
Not crucial though.
I think it would make sense to extract the assertion into another private method and convert checked exceptions into RuntimeExceptions there to get rid of all the throws declarations.
Maybe it's just me, but I think searchTypesByIds implies a map keyed by ID and would prefer the name searchTypesForIds.

commit.message: Reusing `mergeQueryString`.
Verifying nothing has been read by migration.
Verifying something has actually been read by migration.
Rethrowing side exceptions of assertion unchecked.
Changing method name to make purpose clearer.
Using `Collection` when reading lists/sets from mongo.
